intro: Onosma syriaca, commonly known as Syrian thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Onosma syriaca is often found in meadows, wastelands, and along roadsides, where it thrives in full sun.
